entry.title: Ghost encounters in office
entry.content:
I had two ghost encounters in office till to date.

The first one was in a company called Trumatics. I started it with my friend Umashankar who I met in another company called Zanec. We recruited a girl called Vadivikarasi. In that office I used to take walk in the terrace. Once while I was walking I saw Vadivikarasi leaving office, I thought she was leaving early for some reason. I was 40 feet up, and she was on road. I finished my walk and went downstairs to office and there she was Vadivukkarasi. I was shocked and asked her did she leave office and I said to her, I saw her leaving, she too got terrified. Not wanting to make her more afraid I stopped talking about it.

But what ever left that gate had her dress, backpack like her, skin tone like her, the same hold of cell phone while she browses while she leaves our office. It could be a very strange coincidence that I saw someone else and mistook her, or may be my brain got screwed up.

My second encounter was in a company Francium, there was a devops girl who seemed to know the trade, and we talked a lot. She drove an electric bike, at that time there were almost no electric bikes in India. She sat in my room because she is a one who cannot stay without super chill A/C. One day she left home, after some time a guy called Prasanna got introduced, or we were talking after acquitance after some time (may be few days). Suddenly he said my wife is devops here, before I could say I know and ask about the electric bike he said his wife Archana is inside coding.

My heart stopped, just moments ago I saw his wife leave the office, how can I say to him I saw a ghost which was his wife? This Vadivukkarasi incident popped into my mind. This guy Prasanna asked my why I looked tensed. Dam hell how can I ever say I saw a ghost which just left office that looked like his wife. I did not react and went in.

Next day I got a doubt and asked others the name of the devops girl that sits in my room, it was Radha they said. Damn, God, dam, life came into me. I am not a peoples person and I get carried away speaking tech to people I don’t even bother asking about their names and stuff.

Finally, I learned these girls names and memorized how they looked so that I don’t get confused. Radha soon quit office and hence from then on if it was devops girl it was Archana. So no more confusion. It was sad seeing a devops engineer who was talented go out.

I learned a lot about the work ethics of Prasanna and Archana, I think Archana left that office before I did, and I was thrown out all of a sudden, and Prasanna quit too. Now I don’t even know if Francium exists. I wonder if any company that let’s go off good talent due to carless planning ever comes up?
entry.summary: I had two ghost encounters in office till to date.

entry.title: Why use ReactJS, Angular or Vue with Ruby on Rails?

link.title: Why use ReactJS, Angular or Vue with Ruby on Rails?

entry.content:
It’s super mysterious to me why people choose to use ReactJS, Angular or Vue with Ruby on Rails and pay the price for low productivity. It’s like people are blind and pretend to know nothing about code. Or they go by Popularity Driven Development? That is, they choose stuff based on popularity without technical analysis.

Ruby programming language was created to be programmers best friend, and it is, until you reach say nears a million lines of code, at that stage OOP fails, you must switch to functional programming, but for medium-sized apps Ruby is best and Ruby o Rails tries to be Rubyish as much as possible.

Rails emphasizes readability and productivity. JavaScript is a natural eye soar, hard to read, hard to debug. Right from Rails 2 I think there is a way to reduce JS code in Rails. First it was RJS, then you sent request using jQuery and got JS payload back which replaced part of page, then now you have this wonderful HotWire which does the same thus minimizing JavaScript hell.

Throughout history Rails has provided better way to build webpages than any known JS framework. It’s a super mystery for me why anyone would choose a JS framework, increase code complexity, go for large team and ultimately be unproductive.

The reason why big tech created JS frameworks was because they have grown big and wants to manage front and back end teams separately. The front end guy might need to interact with designer, test UI in various devices, connect with the backend using API. The backend person designs API, checks the access capability of the user to a particular piece of data, and if some API is hit, triggers some business logic. Those two are different.

70% of the websites could just be static web pages. You don’t need a front end or backend frameworks for it, another 10% might need a simple scripting like PHP, another 18% might be okay with Rails, Laravel and so on, may be just 2% of the apps will be need to have separate front and back end teams, bureaucracy, planning, inefficiency and so on.

I have a feeling that Indian companies want to bill the client more by adding more people to app development citing complexity, architecture, planning, project management and blah blah, rather than having a lean team, finishing stuff up, and increasing per-capita developer revenue.

Come into the present Info Tech firms!!! Common, you are embarrassing me.

entry.title: Why I think evil people face demise

link.title: Why I think evil people face demise

entry.content:
My friends say it chills their spine to think about what happened to people who did evil to me. For some reason people who did evil to me get destroyed. Most of them are dead, and for many others, their loved ones in their family is dead, thus crippling them to do anything against me. Their spirit of life is taken away, they walk dead never again dare to face me.

Being an atheist, this has baffled me. My friends, this they say that I must start believing in God’s and spirits that protect me. I strongly disagree. Everything is a chance, but very consistent destruction of evil people who come into my life seems baffling. I thought hard about it and here is my theory why they face demise.

We say evil people face demise, but turn it around it’s head and say people who face demise do evil. It’s like Annaduari’s saying “விட்டு கொடுப்பவன் கெட்டு போவதில்ல, கெட்டுப்போபவன் விட்டு கொடுப்பதில்லை” (a person who gives up does not rot, a person who rots does not give up).

Our brain is split, there is more straight forward conscious communication, but there is s subconscious communication between your body and mind. Say that a person has a disease and his subconscious mind realizes it (maybe the person is dying superfast), it feels the pain, it tries to communicate the pain to others in conscious way, and it does by doing evil. It’s the communication of pain of subconscious mind that knows its rotting and ending.

I feel ones subconscious mind can even sense demise of family members and their loved ones at a very early stage and those minds too start doing evil to others.

Finally, when a person dies or looses his or her loved ones, we say it’s because it’s because of the evil deeds they have done, but it could be because they sensed their or loved ones demise without consciously knowing and felt the pain, and so they actually started doing evil as a form of communicating this pain.

There are others that do evil and still thrive, that’s psychopaths, that’s of different dimension, but for those who have faced demise doing evil to me (some have even contacted me to seek forgiveness), this is the only explanation I could come up with.
